name: Japanese
description: Known for its rich history, unique art forms, and technological advancements.
facts: The literacy rate in Japan is almost 100%.
Eating noodles on New Year's Eve is believed to bring longevity in Japan.
Capsule hotels were invented in Japan.

name: Indian
description: Characterized by its diverse languages, religions, and vibrant traditions.
facts: India is the world's largest democracy.
The game of snakes and ladders originated in India.
India is the world's second-largest English-speaking country.

name: Brazilian
description: Famous for its vibrant music, dance, and passionate football culture.
facts: Brazil is the largest country in South America.
Carnival in Rio de Janeiro is one of the world's biggest parties.
Brazil is the world's leading exporter of coffee.

name: Egyptian
description: Home to ancient monuments, pharaohs, and a rich mythological history.
facts: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the oldest and largest of the Giza pyramid complex.
Ancient Egyptians used makeup for protection and beauty.
Cats were considered sacred animals in ancient Egypt.

name: Nigerian
description: Known for its diverse ethnic groups, languages, and vibrant arts scene.
facts: Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa.
Nollywood is the second-largest film industry in the world.

name: Russian
description: A culture known for its deep literary traditions, historical complexity, distinctive cuisine, and strong emphasis on community and hospitality.
facts: Russia spans 11 time zones, making it the largest country in the world by land area.
The Trans-Siberian Railway is the longest railway line in the world.
Russian literature has produced globally influential authors like Tolstoy, Dostoevsky, and Chekhov.
traditions: New Year's celebrations with Ded Moroz (Grandfather Frost)
